config.question: The Contract with America that Congressman Newt Gingrich had all Republican candidates in the 1994 congressional elections sign as pledges of support included familiar conservative goals, such as granting the president the power to __________.

choices.content: veto individual line-items in budget proposals
use discretion in whether to call the military to quell urban riots
raise taxes in order to address the federal deficit
release inmates in overcrowded federal prisons

answer_3.response: A young congressman from Georgia, Newton Leroy “Newt” Gingrich, asked all GOP candidates in the 1994 congressional races to sign a ten-point Contract with America. The contract consisted of familiar conservative goals, including a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution, term limits for members of Congress, a line-item veto for the president, and a middle-class tax cut.
